Exaggerate: The claim may be seen as exaggerating the ease with which a single parent with a couple of kids can receive $35,000 a year in public assistance in Wisconsin.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that a single parent with a couple of kids can easily qualify for $35,000 a year in public assistance without providing sufficient evidence or context to support this assumption.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support or evidence to back up the assertion that a single parent with a couple of kids can easily receive $35,000 a year in public assistance in Wisconsin.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations or factors that may affect the availability or accessibility of public assistance in Wisconsin for single parents with children.
